text: monky be like:
author: Zack Ozga

text: So let me get this straight. You start from frozen Stonehenge in Scotland and fly with a flying saucer to a beach of southern france, from there with a boat through the mediterranean sea fighting a kraken on the way to egypt. Walking through the desert with a man who became a dungeon, crossing a river with a submarine and going through a swamp full of darkness, fighting a pile of puke, arriving at a village full of shy little green creatures, jumping down a hole to a maze with an illuminating neon board all the way deeper into a jungle in the middle of the earth which is full of dinosaurs and next to hell where the revived spirit of a dead alien resides who was brought up by human stepparents who were right your next door american neighbours? Seems legit. And that's only the second half of Earthbound!

text:
Near the North West of Underworld, there is a weird cave. When you enter it, you hear an odd trumpety song, and also you can see a weird wavy verticle rock formation and something that looks like the crashed transporter. Also the cave consists of rocks suspended in a black void.

WTF?

text: Wasn't this entire area supposed to be a movie reference.  Journey to the Centre of the Earth to be specific.  I mean, this game is full of pop culture references.  One NPC calls you Rambo. I don't record games...

text: Yeah, this being one of my all-time favorite RPGs, this game's music really stuck with me because of how unique it was.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text: Get it!  The chances of them releasing it over here are very low.  Don't deprive yourself of the chance to play a great game because of legalities.  A lot of LPer's here on YouTube, me included, play ROMs because it's easier to play a rom on the computer and record it with something like Cam Studio than to go and track down the game legally, then have something like Dazzle to hook up the system to the computer to record it.  Trust me.
author: BygPhattyPlus

author: SupraDarky

text: Actually, the whole Mother series is not JRPGs. It's more DQ based and those are more true blue RPGs than what the market is filled with these days. The Mother series is pure fun and the whole premise is that it is Pop culture in a video game format and a ton of Hippy killing by baseball bats. This my favorite Series of all time.
author: MarioNavi

text:
I started to play Earthbound this year to figure out what the big deal is and I didn't catch it at first. I think that the game is so subtle that you miss what's great about it if you look too hard.

I haven't beaten it yet, but it's so relaing to play... I'm also excited for Mather 3 this week! YAY!

text: It's a simple matter of opinion. I haven't played the game, so I'm not the best to comment, but from what I've seen and read what makes it so fun is the fact it's a mockery of the genre, it's outrageous plot elements, and the graphics which helped it because it was quirky and not ground breaking.

text:
It was made with love, and has a lot of deep meanings in it.
